clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and the Safety of Eradication Therapy for Helicobacter Pylori in Functional Dyspepsia
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 Study of Helicobacter Pylori Eradication Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Korean College of Helicobacter and Upper Gastrointestinal Research

clinical_study.source: Korean College of Helicobacter and Upper Gastrointestinal Research

brief_summary.textblock:
The role of Helicobacter pylori infection in functional dyspepsia remains controversial. Several randomized controlled trials in western countries have shown no significant advantage over placebo. But some recent studies in Asian population were different compared to the result of studies in the Western population. At the present time, it seems to be difficult to conclude the efficacy of the H.pylori eradication therapy in patients with H. pylori-infected functional dyspepsia.
The investigators hypothesize that eradication of Helicobacter pylori has a sustained global symptom improvement in patients with H. pylori infected functional dyspepsia.

detailed_description.textblock: Functional dyspepsia: diagnosed by Rome III criteria of Functional gastrointestinal disorder Treatment regimen: Combination of proton pump inhibitor, Amoxicillin, Clarithromycin for 7 days Placebo: Same shaped placebo drugs

primary_outcome.measure: Global symptom improvement after eradication of Helicobacter pylori in patients with functional dyspepsia therapy)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Symptom assessment at 8 weeks after eradication

secondary_outcome.measure: To improves the quality of life
Global symptom improvement, at 4 weeks after Helicobacter pylori eradication therapy

arm_group.description: Lansoprazole 30 mg bid, for 7 days Clarithromycin 500 mg bid, for 7 days Amoxicillin 1000 mg bid, for 7 days

intervention.description: Lansoprazole 30 mg bid, for 7 days Clarithromycin 500 mg bid, for 7 days Amoxicillin 1000 mg bid, for 7 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Functional dyspepsia by Rome III criteria
- Normal endoscopic findings
- H. pylori positive by Urea breath test
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe concomitant systemic disease
- Patients with GI surgery
- Females with pregnancy or breast-feeding
- Irritable bowel syndrome, inflammatory bowel disease
- Duodenal Ulcer, Gastric Ulcer, GI bleeding
- History of eradication therapy of Helicobacter pylori
- Malignancy
- Psychosomatic disease
